TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit X500DistinguishedName extends System.Security.Cryptography.AsnEncodedData

Docs.summary: Represents the distinguished name of an X509 certificate. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class is like an extension to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2.SubjectName%2A> or <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2.IssuerName%2A> property, which is the name of the person or entity that the certificate is being issued to. X.500 is an international standard for distributed directory services. The distinguished name uses the following format:
[X500:/C=CountryCode/O=Organization/OU=OrganizationUnit/CN=CommonName]
The following field length limits apply:
|Field|Length Limit| |-----------|------------------| |CountryCode|2 characters| |Organization|Up to 64 characters| |OrganizationUnit|Up to 32 characters| |CommonName|Up to 64 characters|
The following guidelines apply:
- Field values can be uppercase or lowercase.
- Delimiters are slash marks (/) and must appear before the first value and between subsequent values.
- Delimiters can be followed by a space.
The following is an example of a correctly formatted name: [X500:/ C=US/ O=Microsoft/ OU=WGA/ CN=TedSt]
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the X500DistinguishedName class.
[!code-cpp[Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.security.crypto_36_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.security.crypto_36_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.security.crypto_36_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string Format(bool multiLine) cil managed

Docs.param: if the return string should contain carriage returns; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Returns a formatted version of an X500 distinguished name for printing or for output to a text window or to a console.
Docs.returns: A formatted string that represents the X500 distinguished name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to print Abstract Syntax Notation number One (ASN.1)-encoded data or output the information to a text box. Use the `multiLine` parameter to control the layout of the output.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName> class.

Docs.summary: Gets the comma-delimited distinguished name from an X500 certificate.
Docs.value: The comma-delimited distinguished name of the X509 certificate.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The distinguished name uses the following format:
[X500:/C=CountryCode/O=Organization/OU=OrganizationUnit/CN=CommonName]
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X500DistinguishedName> class.
